banner.btext: Kuliah ke luar negeri? A4 Admission siap membantu anda!

frontText.textsec: Expert study abroad guidance from A4 Admission

second.textp1: A4 Admission is a leading education consultancy specializing in study abroad programs for high school and university students. We offer tailored admissions support for top destinations like Canada, the USA, the UK, Malta, Russia and Australia.
second.textp2: Our global presence with teams in Asia, Europe And the USA, ensures seamless assistance at every step, from university selection to visa processing and post-arrival settlement.

forth.p: We believe everyone deserves a transformative future by accessing the world’s best education opportunities
forth.p3: First-Hand Experience – Our team studied, worked, and lived in the USA & Canada
forth.p4: 100+ Partner Institutions across major Canadian provinces for seamless settlement
forth.p5: 100% Employment Support via career coaching & industry ties
forth.p7: End-to-End Living Support  From visas to cultural adaptation

fifth.des1: Let’s talk! Sit down with our experienced counselors to discuss your study goals, preferred destination, academic background (GPA), and budget.
fifth.des2: Based on your profile, we’ll recommend the best-fit universities or colleges – including tuition fees, application deadlines, and future employment opportunities.
fifth.des3: No guesswork here. We’ll walk you through exactly what you need – from transcripts and passports to English test scores and letters of recommendation.
fifth.des4: Once you're ready, we’ll take care of submitting your applications and handling the necessary fee payments – all on your behalf.
fifth.des5: 🎉 Good news! If selected, you’ll receive your official Letter of Acceptance (LOA) from the institution.
fifth.des6: With your LOA in hand, you can confidently pay your tuition fees directly to the school.
fifth.des7: Our experts will help you prepare and submit your visa application, ace the interview, and ensure all immigration paperwork is in order.
fifth.des8: We’ll assist with flight bookings, airport pickups, and housing arrangements through our trusted overseas partners.
fifth.des9: Prepare for success! Our final session equips you with essential knowledge and tips for your first week abroad – covering banking, safety, and culture.
fifth.headingbuttom: Your Global Journey Begins Here – With A4 Admission by Your Side!

objective.heading: We believe every people deserve to have a meaningful life by pursuing the best education that the world can offer to.
objective.icon1: 25+ years accumulated experience in the industry
objective.icon2: First-hand experience to study, work, and live in Canada and United States
objective.icon3: We have partners in major Canada provinces to help students get settled in Canada
objective.icon4: 100% employment rate through program career coach
objective.icon6: We understand it is not easy to live abroad, we are here to help students to get the best living experience

left.hb2: Set the foundation for a smoother, more rewarding journey abroad.
left.p1: We help you select a university that not only matches your academic goals but also supports your long-term success making your journey abroad smoother and more fulfilling.

program.ph1: More Than 1000 Programs to Choose From

engineering.el1: Aviation, Aero Space and Pilot Technology

topText.catp: Canada is widely recognized as one of the best countries to live in, thanks to its world-class healthcare system, high-quality education, and exceptional standard of living. Canadians benefit from a strong work-life balance and a reputation for warmth, inclusivity, and community spirit.

subTextL.subhfp0: Canada is celebrated for its inclusive, friendly, and tolerant society. With residents from over 200 ethnic backgrounds, the country warmly welcomes international students from all corners of the globe.
subTextL.subhfp1: As a bilingual nation, Canada is a global leader in language education. French and English are taught as both first and second languages, forming a key part of the Canadian education system.
subTextL.subhfp2: Canada’s education system emphasizes research and innovation. Students have access to cutting-edge facilities supported by government funding and private industry partnerships.
subTextL.subhfp3: International students with Canadian qualifications and relevant work experience may be eligible to apply for permanent residency without leaving the country, offering a smooth transition from study to settlement.
subTextL.subhfp4: Compared to other top study destinations, Canada offers lower tuition fees and cost of living for international students, making quality education more accessible.
subTextL.subhfp5: Consistently ranked by the United Nations as one of the world’s best places to live, Canada offers a high quality of life, respect for human rights, gender equality, and a peaceful, stable society.
subTextL.subhfp6: Canadian campuses provide a dynamic and well-rounded experience from high-tech libraries and Olympic-level sports facilities to music venues, student clubs, and art galleries ensuring a balance of academic and social life.
subTextL.subhfh7: Work While You Study & Post-Graduation Opportunities
subTextL.subhfp7: International students can work part-time (up to 20 hours per week) during academic sessions and full-time during scheduled breaks. After graduation, eligible students may apply for a Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) for up to three years, gaining valuable Canadian work experience.

subTextR.subpr1: Shape Your Future with A4 Admission
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 10 years of experience and strong partnerships with leading institutions worldwide, we guide you every step of the way.
subTextR.subrpt2: Enjoy high acceptance rates, personalized international student support, and a seamless transition into your new academic environment.
subTextR.subrpt3: Benefit from a 100% employment rate among our graduates and our commitment to providing an exceptional living and learning experience.

thirdText.th: Living cost major cities in Canada
thirdText.thfh1: Cost of Living in Major Canadian Cities
thirdText.thfh1p1: As Canada's largest city, Toronto offers vibrant opportunities—but at a premium. High housing, transportation, and food costs make it one of the most expensive places to live in the country. Expect to pay around CAD 2,000/month for a one-bedroom apartment in the city centre, while dining out at a mid-range restaurant typically costs CAD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p2: Located on the west coast, Vancouver is renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty. However, living here comes with a high price tag. A one-bedroom apartment in the city centre averages CAD 1,900/month, with restaurant meals costing around CAD 20. Like Toronto, housing and daily expenses are notably higher than in other regions.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Montreal, the cultural capital of Quebec, offers a more affordable lifestyle compared to Toronto and Vancouver. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city centre is approximately CAD 1,200/month, and a meal at a mid-range restaurant costs around CAD 15 making it a popular choice for students and young professionals.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Situated in Alberta and known for its energy sector, Calgary combines urban living with lower costs. Average rent for a one-bedroom in the city centre is about CAD 1,400/month, and meals typically cost CAD 20. It’s a more budget-friendly option without sacrificing quality of life.
thirdText.thfh1p5: As Canada’s capital, Ottawa balances governmental significance with a relaxed pace of life. Living expenses are moderate, with average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city centre at around CAD 1,400/month, and meals at mid-range restaurants priced around CAD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p6: Manitoba, located in central Canada, is one of the more affordable regions. In Winnipeg, the province's largest city, rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city centre is approximately CAD 1,100/month, while meals at mid-range restaurants are around CAD 15. It's a great choice for those seeking lower living costs.
thirdText.thfh2p1: If you plan to study in Canada, you’ll need a study permit. This official document, issued by the Government of Canada, allows international students to study at a Designated Learning Institution (DLI) for a specific period. Processing times vary based on your country of residence and the time of year. On average, once biometrics are submitted and eligibility criteria are met, it can take up to 20 business weeks to process your application.
thirdText.thfh2p2: International students with a valid study permit and full-time enrollment at a DLI may work up to 20 hours per week during academic sessions and full-time during scheduled breaks (e.g., summer holidays). After graduation, eligible students can apply for a Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP). The PGWP allows you to work in Canada for up to three years, depending on the length of your study program.
thirdText.thfh2p3: Minimum wage in Canada is determined by each province and territory, and rates can vary across the country. On average, hourly wages range from around CAD 12.00 to over CAD 16.00, depending on the region. These rates are reviewed and adjusted periodically to reflect economic conditions, cost of living, and labor market needs. Co-op programs combine academic studies with practical work experience in your field. Offered by many Canadian colleges and universities, these programs typically require students to meet academic standards before becoming eligible for placement. Most co-op terms last 4 to 8 months and provide students with valuable benefits:
thirdText.thfh2p3l1: Gain hands-on experience related to your studies
thirdText.thfh2p3l3: Earn income to help cover tuition and living costs
thirdText.thfh2p3l4: Clarify your career goals through real-world exposure
thirdText.thfh2p4: Co-op programs are a fantastic way to enhance your education while preparing for the job market.
thirdText.thfh3p5: Canada is situated in North America, stretching from the Atlantic Ocean in the east to the Pacific Ocean in the west, and extending northward into the Arctic Ocean. With a total land area of 9.98 million square kilometers (3.85 million square miles), it is the second-largest country in the world. To put it in perspective, Canada is over five times larger than Indonesia.
thirdText.thfh3p6: Canada experiences four distinct seasons, each offering a unique experience:
thirdText.thfh2p6l1: Spring (March to May): Mild and often rainy, with temperatures typically ranging from 5°C to 20°C.
thirdText.thfh2p6l2: Summer (June to August): Warm to hot across most regions, with temperatures between 20°C and 35°C.
thirdText.thfh2p6l3: Fall (September to November): Cool and comfortable, often featuring vibrant autumn colors. Temperatures range from 10°C to 20°C.
thirdText.thfh2p6l4: Winter (December to February): Cold and snowy, especially in central and northern areas. Winter temperatures can drop to -10°C to -35°C, depending on the region.

topText.uath: Study Abroad in the United States
topText.uatp: The United States remains one of the top destinations for international students, known for its prestigious universities, dynamic cities, diverse communities, and cutting-edge research. Students enjoy a high standard of education, strong career prospects, and a culturally rich environment that encourages innovation and inclusion.

subTextL.subTextLh: Why Study in the United States
subTextL.subhfp0: The United States offers world-class education through top-ranked universities known for academic excellence, innovation, and flexibility. Students benefit from expert faculty, hands-on learning, and the freedom to tailor their studies. With access to cutting-edge research and real-world opportunities, a U.S. degree is globally recognized and highly valued.
subTextL.subhfp1: The U.S. offers an extensive variety of academic programs across hundreds of institutions, allowing students to study virtually any field of interest. From arts and humanities to science, technology, and business, students have the flexibility to combine majors, switch disciplines, and customize their education to match their goals and passions.
subTextL.subhfp2: Degrees from U.S. institutions are highly respected worldwide, often seen as a mark of excellence and innovation. Graduates from American universities are valued by employers and academic institutions globally, giving them a competitive edge in the job market and access to international career and academic opportunities.
subTextL.subhfh3: Research Opportunities in the United States
subTextL.subhfp3: The U.S. is a global leader in research and innovation, offering students access to cutting-edge facilities, extensive funding, and collaborative projects across disciplines. Many universities partner with industries, government agencies, and international organizations, allowing students to engage in meaningful research that drives real-world impact.

subTextR.subpr1: Rencanakan masa depanmu dengan A4 Admission
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Cost of Living in Major U.S. Cities
thirdText.thfh1p1: The city that never sleeps comes with a high cost of living. Expect to pay around USD 2,500/month for a one-bedroom apartment in Manhattan. A meal at a mid-range restaurant costs about USD 25.
thirdText.thfh1p2: Affordable and student-friendly, Atlanta's city center rent is about USD 1,600/month, and a typical meal costs USD 15–20.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Rent for a one-bedroom apartment can range from $3,000 to $4,500 per month, while other monthly expenses can range from $1,000 to $1,500.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Known for its architecture and affordability compared to NYC or LA. Rent in the city center is about USD 1,800/month, with restaurant meals around USD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p5: As a major education hub, Boston can be pricey. Rent near universities averages USD 2,200/month, and meals cost around USD 20–25.
thirdText.thfh2: International Student in the United States
thirdText.thfh2p1: To study in the U.S., you’ll need an F-1 visa, which allows full-time study at a certified institution. Visa processing times vary by country and season but generally take a few weeks after your embassy interview and document submission.
thirdText.thfh2p2: F-1 visa holders can work on-campus part-time and apply for Curricular Practical Training (CPT) or Optional Practical Training (OPT) for off-campus work. OPT allows you to work up to 12 months post-graduation — with an additional 24-month extension for STEM graduates.
thirdText.thfh2p3: Minimum wage is determined by each state. While the federal rate is USD 7.25/hour, states like California, New York, and Washington offer higher rates, some exceeding USD 15/hour.
thirdText.thfh2p4: Many U.S. institutions offer co-op programs that blend academics with real-world experience. These placements, often paid, help students:
thirdText.thfh2ph4l1: Apply classroom knowledge in the workplace
thirdText.thfh2ph4l4: Discover their strengths and career interests
thirdText.thfh3: Geography Facts of the United States
thirdText.thfh3p5: The U.S. stretches across North America from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean and borders Canada and Mexico. It comprises 50 states and a range of geographic regions, making it one of the most diverse countries in the world by landscape and climate.
thirdText.thfh3p6: Due to its size, the U.S. has a wide variety of climates:
thirdText.thfh2ph5l1: Northeast (e.g., New York, Boston): Cold winters (down to -10°C), warm summers (up to 30°C)
thirdText.thfh2ph5l2: Southeast (e.g., Florida): Mild winters, hot and humid summers
thirdText.thfh2ph5l3: Midwest (e.g., Chicago): Harsh winters, humid summers
thirdText.thfh2ph5l4: West Coast (e.g., California): Mild winters, warm and dry summers
thirdText.thfh2ph5l5: Southwest (e.g., Arizona): Very hot summers, mild winters

topText.ukath: Study Abroad in the United Kingdom
topText.ukatp: The United Kingdom remains one of the top destinations for international students, known for its prestigious universities, rich cultural history, and globally respected education system. Students enjoy world-class academic programs, strong career prospects, and an environment that fosters innovation, diversity, and inclusion.

subTextL.subTextLh: Why Study in the United Kingdom
subTextL.subhfp0: The United Kingdom offers a world-class education through renowned universities known for their academic excellence, innovation, and research contributions. Students benefit from expert faculty, a strong emphasis on critical thinking, and the freedom to explore diverse academic fields. A degree from a UK institution is highly regarded and opens doors to global opportunities.
subTextL.subhfp1: The UK offers a wide array of academic programs across a variety of disciplines, from arts and humanities to science, technology, engineering, and business. Students can choose from traditional degree programs, as well as vocational and specialized courses, allowing them to tailor their education to their personal interests and career goals.
subTextL.subhfp2: Degrees from UK universities are globally respected and recognized for their quality. Graduates are highly sought after by employers and academic institutions around the world, providing a competitive edge in the global job market and offering numerous international career opportunities.
subTextL.subhfp3: The United Kingdom is a hub for research and innovation, offering students access to state-of-the-art facilities, ample funding, and collaborative opportunities. Universities in the UK are home to groundbreaking research across disciplines, with many students participating in projects that address real-world challenges and contribute to societal advancement.

subTextR.subpr1: Rencanakan masa depanmu dengan A4 Admission
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Cost of Living in Major UK Cities
thirdText.thfh1p1: London, the capital and cultural center of the UK, has a high cost of living. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center averages £2,000/month, and dining out at a mid-range restaurant typically costs around £25.
thirdText.thfh1p2: The Scottish capital offers a rich historical experience and lower living costs. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center averages £1,200/month, and meals in mid-range restaurants cost about £20.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Known for its vibrant culture and student population, Manchester offers a more affordable lifestyle compared to London. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around £1,100/month, with meals at restaurants costing approximately £15–£20.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Birmingham is a major city in the Midlands region of England. Accommodation costs in Birmingham are generally lower than in London or Edinburgh, with the average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in central Birmingham being around £500 - £800
thirdText.thfh1p5: Located in the southwest, Bristol offers a more affordable living option. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around £1,150/month, and dining out averages £20 per meal.
thirdText.thfh1p6: Liverpool, known for its music history and cultural scene, is one of the more budget-friendly cities in the UK. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is about £900/month, and restaurant meals typically cost around £15.
thirdText.thfh2: International Student in the United Kingdom
thirdText.thfh2p1: To study in the UK, international students must obtain a Tier 4 (General) student visa, allowing them to study full-time at a recognized institution. Visa processing times vary, but generally, it can take up to 8 weeks after the submission of documents.
thirdText.thfh2p2: International students with a valid student visa can work part-time during the academic term (up to 20 hours per week) and full-time during scheduled breaks (e.g., summer). Graduates may also apply for a post-study work visa, allowing them to stay and work in the UK for a limited time.
thirdText.thfh2p3: Minimum wage in the UK is set by the government and varies based on age and job type. As of 2022, the National Living Wage for those aged 23 and over is £9.50 per hour, while younger workers may earn less. Rates are reviewed annually to reflect economic conditions.
thirdText.thfh2p4: Many UK institutions offer co-op programs that blend academic study with practical work experience. These placements provide students with opportunities to:
thirdText.thfh2p4lm1: Apply academic knowledge in real-world environments
thirdText.thfh2p4lm3: Earn income to offset tuition and living expenses
thirdText.thfh2p4lm4: Gain valuable experience that helps clarify career goals
thirdText.thfh3p5: The United Kingdom is located in northwestern Europe, comprising four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. It is bordered by the Atlantic Ocean, the North Sea, the English Channel, and the Irish Sea.
thirdText.thfh3p6: The UK has a temperate maritime climate, characterized by mild temperatures and moderate rainfall throughout the year:
thirdText.thfh2p6lm1: Southern England: Generally mild winters (around 5°C) and cool summers (up to 20°C).
thirdText.thfh2p6lm2: Northern Scotland: Winters can be colder (down to -5°C), with cooler summers.
thirdText.thfh2p6lm3: Western Coast: Rainfall is more frequent, especially in Wales and the Lake District

topText.auatp: Australia is a top destination for international students, known for its world-class universities, stunning landscapes, and vibrant, multicultural cities. Students enjoy exceptional education, career prospects, and an inclusive environment that fosters creativity, innovation, and personal growth.

subTextL.subhfp0: Australia is home to some of the world’s top universities, offering academic excellence and innovation across a wide range of disciplines. With expert faculty, a focus on practical learning, and a strong research culture, a degree from an Australian institution is highly respected globally and opens doors to international opportunities.
subTextL.subhfp1: Australia offers a diverse array of academic programs, from arts and humanities to science, technology, engineering, and business. Students can choose from traditional degrees, vocational training, and specialized courses, giving them the flexibility to shape their education according to their interests and career aspirations.
subTextL.subhfp2: Australian degrees are globally recognized for their high quality and rigorous academic standards. Graduates from Australian universities are in high demand worldwide, with employers and academic institutions around the globe valuing the skills, knowledge, and qualifications gained from studying in Australia.
subTextL.subhfp3: Australia is a leader in research and innovation, providing students with access to cutting-edge facilities, substantial funding, and collaborative opportunities across various fields. Many Australian universities are at the forefront of global research, allowing students to contribute to projects that tackle global challenges and make a positive impact.

subTextR.subpr1: Rencanakan masa depanmu dengan A4 Admission
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Cost of Living in Major Australian Cities
thirdText.thfh1p1: As Australia's largest and most well-known city, Sydney is known for its high cost of living. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center averages AUD 2,500/month, with dining out at mid-range restaurants costing around AUD 25.
thirdText.thfh1p2: Known for its vibrant arts and cultural scene, Melbourne offers a more affordable lifestyle compared to Sydney. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is about AUD 1,800/month, while meals at mid-range restaurants typically cost AUD 20–25.
thirdText.thfh1p3: With a laid-back lifestyle and growing economy, Brisbane offers an affordable cost of living. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is approximately AUD 1,600/month, and meals at restaurants cost around AUD 15–20.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Located on Australia’s western coast, Perth offers affordable living compared to eastern cities. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center averages AUD 1,500/month, and meals at restaurants cost around AUD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p5: Adelaide is one of the more budget-friendly cities in Australia. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is about AUD 1,200/month, and dining out at mid-range restaurants typically costs AUD 15–20.
thirdText.thfh2p1: To study in Australia, international students must apply for a student visa (subclass 500). This visa allows full-time study at a registered institution. Visa processing times vary, but it typically takes a few weeks after submitting the necessary documents.
thirdText.thfh2p2: With a student visa, international students can work up to 40 hours per fortnight during the semester and full-time during semester breaks. Post-graduation, students can apply for a Temporary Graduate Visa (subclass 485), allowing them to work in Australia for up to 4 years, depending on their qualifications.
thirdText.thfh2p3: Australia has one of the highest minimum wages globally. As of 2022, the national minimum wage is AUD 20.33 per hour. Rates are reviewed annually by the Fair Work Commission and may vary depending on the industry and employment contract.
thirdText.thfh2p4: Many Australian universities offer co-op programs that combine academic studies with hands-on work experience. These programs help students:
thirdText.thfh2p4lm1: Apply theoretical knowledge in a real-world setting
thirdText.thfh2p4lm4: Gain valuable experience and enhance employability
thirdText.thfh3p5: Australia is located in the Southern Hemisphere and is the world’s sixth-largest country. It consists of the mainland, Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands. It is surrounded by the Indian and Pacific Oceans, offering diverse landscapes ranging from beaches to deserts and rainforests.
thirdText.thfh3p6: Australia’s climate is diverse due to its size:
thirdText.thfh2p6lm1: Northern Australia: Tropical climate with hot, humid summers and mild winters.
thirdText.thfh2p6lm2: Western Australia: Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild winters.
thirdText.thfh2p6lm3: Eastern Coast: Humid subtropical climate, with milder winters and hot, humid summers.

topText.nuatp: New Zealand is an increasingly popular destination for international students, known for its world-class education, breathtaking landscapes, and welcoming, multicultural society. Students enjoy high-quality academic programs, strong career prospects, and an environment that promotes creativity, adventure, and personal growth.

subTextL.subhfp0: New Zealand is home to some of the world’s best universities, offering exceptional education that emphasizes practical skills, critical thinking, and innovation. With highly qualified faculty, modern teaching methods, and a focus on research, degrees from New Zealand institutions are recognized and respected globally.
subTextL.subhfp1: New Zealand offers a broad selection of academic programs across diverse fields, from arts and humanities to engineering, business, and technology. Students can choose from undergraduate, postgraduate, and vocational training courses, allowing them to tailor their education to their career ambitions and personal interests.
subTextL.subhfp2: Degrees from New Zealand are internationally recognized and respected for their quality. Graduates from New Zealand universities are highly regarded by employers around the world, with a reputation for being skilled, innovative, and well-prepared for global job markets.
subTextL.subhfp3: New Zealand is known for its innovative research culture, offering students access to state-of-the-art facilities and opportunities to collaborate with industry and academia. Many New Zealand universities are involved in ground-breaking research, allowing students to contribute to projects with real-world impacts on global challenges.

subTextR.subpr1: Rencanakan masa depanmu dengan A4 Admission
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Cost of Living in Major New Zealand Cities
thirdText.thfh1p1: Auckland is the largest and most populous city in New Zealand, offering a dynamic lifestyle but with a higher cost of living. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center averages NZD 2,100/month, and dining out at mid-range restaurants typically costs around NZD 25.
thirdText.thfh1p2: The capital city of New Zealand, Wellington offers a more affordable lifestyle compared to Auckland. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around NZD 1,800/month, with meals at restaurants costing NZD 20–25.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Christchurch, known as the 'Garden City,' offers a balance of city life and outdoor beauty at a more affordable price. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is about NZD 1,500/month, and meals at mid-range restaurants cost around NZD 15–20.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Located in the North Island, Hamilton offers a lower cost of living compared to other major cities. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center averages NZD 1,400/month, and meals in mid-range restaurants cost NZD 15–20.
thirdText.thfh1p5: Dunedin, a smaller city known for its Scottish heritage and proximity to nature, offers a more affordable lifestyle. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is about NZD 1,200/month, and meals typically cost NZD 15–20.
thirdText.thfh2p1: To study in New Zealand, international students must apply for a student visa, which allows full-time study at a recognized institution. Visa processing times can vary, but typically it takes a few weeks once all necessary documents are submitted.
thirdText.thfh2p2: International students with a valid student visa can work up to 20 hours per week during the academic year and full-time during breaks. After graduation, students may be eligible for a Post-Study Work Visa, allowing them to stay and work in New Zealand for up to three years, depending on their qualification.
thirdText.thfh2p3: New Zealand’s minimum wage is set by the government and is one of the highest in the world. As of 2022, the minimum wage is NZD 21.20 per hour, with annual reviews to ensure it reflects economic conditions.
thirdText.thfh2p4: Many New Zealand universities offer co-op programs, which combine academic learning with practical, paid work experience. These programs help students:
thirdText.thfh2p4lm1: Apply classroom knowledge in the workplace
thirdText.thfh2p4lm4: Gain valuable experience to improve employability
thirdText.thfh3p5: New Zealand is located in the southwestern Pacific Ocean, comprising two main islands — the North Island and South Island — along with many smaller islands. Its unique geography includes dramatic mountains, forests, beaches, and lakes, making it one of the world’s most scenic countries.
thirdText.thfh3p6: New Zealand’s climate is temperate, offering mild winters and warm summers:
thirdText.thfh2p6lm1: North Island: Subtropical climate, with hot, humid summers and mild winters.
thirdText.thfh2p6lm2: South Island: More temperate, with cooler winters and warm, dry summers.
thirdText.thfh2p6lm3: Coastal Areas: Mild weather with rainfall, especially on the west coast, known for its lush rainforests.

tophero.ap: A4 Admissionucation Consulting is an education agency with global offices. We offer expert guidance to students seeking to pursue their dream of studying abroad.

second.asp: We believe everyone deserves the opportunity to lead a meaningful life by pursuing the best education the world has to offer. Moving to a new country can be challenging for any international student, and we understand that firsthand. Having relocated internationally in 2010, we've experienced what it's like to study, live, and work abroad. Our goal is to share our knowledge and experiences with students, helping them navigate life and education in a new country.

thirdevnt.tp6: Learn all the important updates on Canadian immigration policies, Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP), and how these changes could affect your future in Canada! Don’t miss out on this opportunity to get accurate information and clear guidance.

contactFront.heading: Need Help? Let’s Connect!
contactFront.subheading: Got questions about studying abroad or need support with your application? We're here to guide you every step of the way.

second.sh: Frequently Asked Questions for new students
second.sp1: As you navigate the next exciting chapter of your academic life by starting your master’s or doctoral degree, we know you may have some questions.
second.sp2: Below we provide you with some answers! If you don’t see your question (and your answer!), please explore the ways that you can connect with us to access the information you need.
second.glh1: WHAT ARE THE STEPS IN THE PROCESS OF REGISTERING FOR STUDIES AND VISA?
second.glp1l2: Translate the transcript and high school diploma
second.glh2: What documents do I need to apply for a Study Permit?
second.glp2l1: Fill out the visa application form
second.glp2l4: Letter of acceptance from the university or college
second.glp2l6: Financial support proof (between CAD $35,000 - $60,000 for the last 4 months)
second.glp2l7: Pay the application fee of $150 and $85 for biometrics
second.glp2l8: The processing time will take 1 - 2 months.
second.glh3: How much is consultation fee with A4 Admission?
second.glp3l1: If the visa is rejected, the college/university will issue a full refund minus the application and administrative fees.
second.glh4: How much is consultation fee with A4 Admission?
second.glp4l1: IELTS test (5.5-6.5 depending on the school)
second.glp4l2: Copies of high school transcripts & diploma (translated into Indonesian and English by a sworn translator)
second.glp4l5: Portfolio (if applying to a Design program)
second.glh5: How much is the cost to study in Canada?
second.glp5l1: The costs range from CAD $9,000 to CAD $20,000 per year for colleges and CAD $35,000 to CAD $60,000 per year for universities.
second.glh6: How difficult is it for new students to adapt?
second.glp6l1: A4 Admission has over 25 years of experience in studying, working, and living in Canada, particularly in the areas of Ontario and Manitoba. Therefore, our goal is to assist new students by guiding and providing all useful information that can help them adapt to their new environment. Our team in Canada will guide newly arrived students (especially in the areas of Ontario and Manitoba). Before departure, we will also introduce some students who are already in Canada.
second.glh7: What kind of accomodations should I choose?
second.glp7l3: We recommend new students to live in on-campus homestay/dormitories to meet other students while learning about new cultures and environments. This makes it easier for new students to make new friends and adapt. For further explanations, please contact our counselor team.
second.glh8: Can I work while study in Canada?
second.glp8l1: The Canadian government allows international students to work during their studies, both on and off-campus. Students can apply for part-time work for up to 20 hours per week during their studies and up to 40 hours per week during summer breaks. The minimum wage is approximately $15 per hour.
second.glh9: How A4 Admission guide me to choose the campus and program?
second.glp9l1: Collaborating with 1,000+ campuses, we provide a catalog of college and university partners based on program interests and prepared costs. This is supplemented with more in-depth information, such as the percentage of employment after graduation from our college and university partners.
second.glh10: I don't know what program to choose yet, how can A4 Admission provide guidance?
second.glp10l1: Our counselor team will provide personalized consultations with prospective students and their parents. We will assist in selecting a study program that aligns with the budget, interests, abilities, and desired career goals. This way, prospective students can make informed decisions and be well-prepared for their studies in Canada.
second.glh11: What is the estimated cost of living in Canada per month?
second.glh12: What is the estimated part-time salary I can earn while studying?
second.glh13: What kind of part-time jobs can I do while studying?
second.glp13l1: Students can work on-campus in places such as bookstores, libraries, fitness centers, cafeterias, and off-campus in places like restaurants, shopping centers, supermarkets, and more.
second.glp13l2: It is also possible for students to work part-time in companies as receptionists, administrative staff, call-center operators, and other similar positions.
second.glh14: Can I also have direct discussions with campus representatives?
second.glp14l1: We regularly organize info sessions with college/university representatives, where students and parents can have direct and more private consultations.
second.glp15l1: Colleges and universities will provide scholarship information on their respective websites. Students can apply separately by following the application process on their own.
second.plh1: Is there any additional requirements to send minor child to study in Canada?
second.plp1l1: Students under the age of 17, accompanied by their parents, need to go through the process of custodianship. A4 Admission will assist in the application process.
second.plh2: Is there any additional requirements to send minor child to study in Canada?
second.plp2l1: Make sure that the child has essential documents such as academic records, passport, and required health insurance. Prepare sufficient funds for the child's education abroad, including school fees, living expenses, airfare, and any other potential expenses. Of course, ensure that parents choose the right consultant.
second.plh3: How to open a bank account in Canada?
second.plp3l1: Students can open individual bank accounts in Canada without having to go through their parents' accounts. However, if they are still under age, some banks may require parental or guardian consent before opening a bank account. Be sure to check the requirements of the chosen bank before opening an account.
second.plh4: Can I accompany my child to go to study abroad?
second.plp4l1: Parents can travel together with their child with a tourist visa.
second.plh5: How can I send money from Indonesia to my child studying abroad?
second.plp5l1: Through the bank: Make sure you know your child's bank account details, the receiving bank's SWIFT code, and any other necessary information for the money transfer.
second.plp5l2: Through international money transfer services: For example, Western Union, MoneyGram, and TransferWise.
second.plp5l3: Via international credit or debit cards: You can add your child as an authorized user on your international credit or debit card and transfer money directly to the card.
second.plp5l4: Be sure to check the fees and currency conversion rates before choosing the appropriate money transfer method.
second.plh6: If my child gets sick, does the campus have a clinic or hospital?
second.plp6l1: Some campuses have on-campus medical clinics with on-duty doctors. If a student sick, they can visit the campus clinic, and the on-duty doctor will provide referrals (if necessary) to the nearest hospital.
second.plh7: Is it important to have insurance from Indonesia, or can it be arranged upon arrival in Canada?
second.plp7l1: If parents have purchased insurance for their child in Indonesia, make sure to check with the insurance company if it can be used abroad as well.
second.plp7l2: Some campuses have included health insurance in the tuition fees.
second.plh8: Are there any A4 Admission staff to pick up my child if I am not accompanying them during the journey?
second.plp8l1: Upon arrival, students will be picked up as requested by the parents.
second.plh9: How safe is it for my child to live in Canada?
second.plp9l1: Canada has a relatively low crime rate and is known for its inclusive and friendly culture towards foreign nationals. The Canadian government also provides strong legal protection for all citizens, including international students. However, like anywhere in the world, there are still some risks to be aware of, such as street crime, cybercrime, and others. Therefore, it is essential for international students to always be cautious.
second.plh10: I want to compare tuition fees and living expenses in Canada with other countries. How will A4 Admission explain this?
second.plp10l1: A4 Admission will provide a comprehensive explanation of the tuition fees and living costs in Canada compared to other countries. We will offer detailed information about the educational expenses, including tuition fees, accommodation costs, transportation, food, and other miscellaneous expenses in different countries. Through personalized consultations, we will help you make informed decisions based on your preferences, budget, and academic interests, ensuring you have a clear understanding of the financial aspects of studying in Canada and other potential study destinations.
